org.drip.curve.calibration
Interface ComponentCalibrator

All Known Implementing Classes:
ComponentCalibratorBracketing, ComponentCalibratorNR
public interface ComponentCalibrator

This interface defines the curve calibration methods – bootstrapping the discount rate and the hazard rate from the individual component quotes. Calibration can be node-by-node (true bootstrapping) or flat.

Method Summary
 boolean bootstrapHazardRate(CreditCurve cc, Component comp, int iInstr, ValuationParams valParams, DiscountCurve dc, DiscountCurve dcTSY, DiscountCurve dcEDSF, PricerParams pricerParams, java.lang.String strMeasure, double dblCalibValue, java.util.Map<JulianDate,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double>> mmFixings, QuotingParams quotingParams, boolean bFlat)

          Bootstraps the interest rate curve from the component quote

                              DiscountCurve dcEDSF,

                              QuotingParams quotingParams,
                              boolean bFlat)
Bootstraps the interest rate curve from the component quote

Parameters:
dc - Discount Curve
dcTSY - Treasury Discount Curve
dcEDSF - EDSF Discount Curve
comp - Calibration Component
iInstr - Bootstrap index
valParams - ValuationParams
strMeasure - Component measure to be calibrated
dblCalibValue - Component measure quote
mmFixings - Fixings object
quotingParams - Quoting Parameters
bFlat - Flat calibration (true), True bootstrapping (false)
Returns:
Success (true), failure (false)
